thread.title: World's largest Lego exhibit, Cincinnati Museum Center
thread.title_full: World's largest Lego exhibit, Cincinnati Museum Center | www.daytondailynews.com

author: Meredith Moss
title: World's largest Lego exhibit, Cincinnati Museum Center
text:
You’ll be tempted to go digging in your attic or basement for that old box of Legos once you’ve seen the amazing sculptures by artist Nathan Sawaya .
We had the chance to meet the New York artist today at a sneak preview of his exhibit, “The Art of the Brick,” which officially opens Friday at the Cincinnati Museum Center .
The colorful show is billed as the world’s largest and most elaborate display of Lego art and features more than 100 works of art — including a 20-foot T-Rex skeleton made of 80,0000 Legos. There’s an interactive area for the kids as well and a shop filled with you-know-what.
“I keep four-and-a-half million Legos in my art studio at all times,” Sawaya told me.
To hear more of our interview, watch for the story in the Dayton Daily News Sunday Life & Arts section on Nov. 15.
